sense.gloss: han (estate of a daimyo in the Edo and early Meiji periods), feudal domain, fief, province
the same domain, the same province
abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures (1871)
han school, school established by a daimyo for educating the children of the domain's retainers
clanship, clannism, clan favoritism, clan favouritism

sdata.j: ↑江戸↑↓えど↓↑時代↑↓じだい↓に、↑各↑↓かく↓↑藩↑↓はん↓の↑奨励↑↓しょうれい↓↑策↑↓さく↓によって、↑全国↑↓ぜんこく↓↑各地↑↓かくち↓に↑地場↑↓じば↓↑産業↑↓さんぎょう↓が↑興↑↓おこ↓った。
sdata.e: Local industry flourished throughout the land in the Edo period thanks to the promotional efforts by each clan.

words.gloss: han (estate of a daimyo in the Edo and early Meiji periods), feudal domain, fief, province
